ab:
I advise rising at 6am Summer and Winter,
Prayers Bath and Shave up to 7
Breakfast from 7.15 to 7.45 including H.C.
Carriage 7.45 to 8 arrive Surrey St
In Workshops at 8 prompt seeing to work until 1pm from 1 to 2 dinner in private room Hot one day Cold next leave Surrey St at 7om by Carriage this to apply to Mon Tues Wed Thur Fri - Saturday each alternately a holiday.

ab: In Business - I think if Health will permit it is a very good thing to be in the workshops at 2pm to see all at their work doing it correctly and properly

Saturdays I think the time for the one who takes duty might be 8 to 3 short Cold Lunch making 57 hours whish is more than the workmen make, to make up for this the following week he has but 50 hours to make and which with probable over minutes will bring the working Masters hours to an average of 54 hours weekly as at present worked in Shops June 17th 1890
